nodes.bodyText: it's a bit odd and confusing for me. So with repair endpoint/request will we be able to scale the size of the FreeIPA cluster? Is it really a repair functionality? also the naming, instanceCountByGroup a bit odd, as we don't really specify any group in the request

I removed the instance count by group from the repair event but it is still in the downscale/upscale. Downscale/upscale adjust the instance count only when not doing a repair (which will be used in the future but its not used now).

so I see you reused this in AbstractUpscaleActions, but I think it's not best way to go. I would either duplicate this method, or introduce an AbstractScaleActions (or similar) class to have the common part instead of making these into public static
I created the AbstractScaleActions.
so I don't understand this. Why do we set it to DOWNSCALE_IN_PROGRESS when it's finished?

A repair operation will consist of a downscale followed by an upscale. If I mark the status as DOWNSCALE_COMPLETE then the cluster will temporarily report a status of available instead of "update in progress". I think this will be a misleading race condition for external consumers of the FreeIPA APIs. When upscale is finished, then it will report a status of UPSCALE_COMPLETE which will map to available.
I think we should still replace this with something more appropriate. I'm open for ideas. My first thoughts are REPAIR_IN_PROGRESS or WAITING_FOR_UPSCALE
I updated downscale/upscale to set the status to REPAIR_IN_PROGRESS when its a repair operation. It will mark it as complete when upscale finishes.
is it called DOWNSCALE_HOSTS on purpose?
Thanks for catching this.

it would be a bit more compact with streams:
Optional<Long> max = instanceGroups.stream()
                        .flatMap(ig -> ig.getAllInstanceMetaData().stream())
                        .filter(im -> im.getPrivateId() != null)
                        .max(Comparator.comparing(InstanceMetaData::getPrivateId))
                        .map(InstanceMetaData::getPrivateId);
should be: UpscaleStackRequest<UpscaleStackResult> request = new UpscaleStackRequest<>(
could you refactor the if-else branches to methods?
nit: you could use stack instead of context.getStack()
could you refactor this? like move the rest of the method to a separate one, and put that call in the if.
this might worth to be refactored into it's own method
This is not longer applicable since repair cannot change the total number of instances per instance group.
typo: Mand -> Many
This is not longer applicable since repair cannot change the total number of instances per instance group.
this seems to me to be a duplicate. we might move this method to a separate class. it would make testing easier

I agree its a duplicate. Right now, we have cloudbreak core and freeipa versions of InstanceGroup. They don't share common interfaces. This is the same for a bunch of other classes. While it would be nice to refactor this with a shared API, a shared private instance probably isn't too valuable by itself.
